title: Decorators
overview: Learn how Python decorators modify the behavior of functions using the @ syntax. Decorators are powerful tools for logging, access control, and code reuse.
practice: Create a decorator that logs function calls.
Create a decorator that checks user login.
Use multiple decorators on one function.
summary: Decorators are advanced Python features that let you wrap functions to extend or modify their behavior without changing their code. They are widely used for logging, validation, authentication, and more.
